alert.note: Alert for Athens; Meigs; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 4:05AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following counties, Athens, Meigs and Washington. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 358 AM EST, local law enforcement and transportation departments reported multiple road closures due to flooding. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marietta, Belpre, Pomeroy, Racine, Coolville, Rutland, Forked Run State Park, Williamstown, New Haven, Mason, Tuppers Plains, Washington, Middleport, Chester, Syracuse, Hartford City, Little Hocking, Blennerhassett, Darwin and Fleming. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
